item.title: China's expanding rail network in Tibet nears Sikkim
item.description: Qinghai-Tibet Railway, world's highest railway, will reach the residence of Panchen Lama at Xigaze in Tibet

item.title: CEO of bitcoin exchange found dead in Singapore
item.description: The future of bitcoin has been under scrutiny since the collapse of the Mt. Gox exchange in Tokyo last month

item.title: Top Massachusetts court rules 'upskirt' photos legal
item.description: The decision by the Massachusetts court has ignited a heated debate and outcry on social sites like Twitter

item.title: Nine-month-old baby may have been cured of HIV, U.S. scientists say
item.description: A nine-month-old baby who was born in California with the HIV virus may have been cured; doctors began administering antiretroviral drugs just four hours after the baby was born and is now said to have become HIV-negative

item.title: Hillary Clinton tries to fix Putin-Hitler comparison
item.description: A day after Hillary Clinton compared Russia President Vladimir Putin to German dictator Adolf Hitler, she clarifies her statement saying she wasn’t making a comparison but that she was recommending learning from a tactic that has been used before; she was referring to Putin sending forces to Crimea

item.title: China hikes defence budget by 12.2% to $132 bn
item.description: China announces 12.2 per cent hike in defence budget taking militay spending to $132 billion; India’s defence budget is $36 billion

item.title: Arctic cold sets records in eastern United States
item.description: Deadly storm expected in coming days in eastern and central US; temperatures will reach below average as has been for a good part of the winter

item.title: Snowden, Putin among nominees for this year’s Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: A record 278 candidates for this year’s Nobel Peace Prize; Edward Snowden, Malala Yousafzai and Vladimir Putin are among the nominees

item.title: UK denies deciding against trade sanctions on Russia
item.description: Foreign Secretary William Hague says no announcement will be made till EU leaders meet on Thursday

item.title: Pakistani man hands over 3 sons to Hafiz Saeed for jihad
item.description: Jamaat-ud-Dawa is the parent body of banned terror group Lashkar-e-Taiba that carried out 2008 Mumbai attacks

item.title: Putin denies Russian forces operating in Crimea
item.description: Russian president Vaadimir Putin says Russian forces have no role in Crimea stand-off

item.title: Putin recalls armed forces from ‘military exercise’
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin orders conclusion of ‘military exercise’ on borders of Ukraine but stand-off in the Crimean region remains unaffected

item.title: Microsoft's Gates reclaims title as world's richest
item.description: $507 billion held by the top ten is larger than the entire size of the economy of Norway, Belgium or Poland in 2012

item.title: Terror trial of Osama bin Laden's son-in-law begins in New York
item.description: Terror trial of Suleiman Abu Ghaith, son-in-law of Osama bin Laden and former Al-Qaeda spokesman, begins in New York; prosecution claims he was complicit in December 2001 shoe bombing plot to bring down an airliner flying from Paris to Miami

item.title: Powerful storm lashes eastern U.S. with snow, arctic cold
item.description: More than 2900 flights cancelled and 5000 delayed as a deadly winter storm hits the US East Coast; schools and local government closed due to freezing rain and snow

item.title: Ukraine bases across Crimea surrounded, Russia gives ultimatum
item.description: Military presence in Crimea region continues to build up, as Russian forces try to pressure Ukrainian army and navy installations into surrounding

item.title: China holds three for Kunming station attack
item.description: Suspects involved in terror attack in which 33 people were killed and more than 130 injured

item.title: Lavrov slams threats of 'sanctions and boycotts' over Ukraine
item.description: Russian Foreign Minister responds to concerted calls from West telling Russia to withdraw from Ukraine in military stand-off

item.title: Ukraine 'biggest crisis in Europe in 21st century': Hague
item.description: Tense military stand-off between Russia and the West, over Ukraine, could become worst armed conflict since World War II

item.title: Russia must 'refrain' from escalating Ukraine crisis: UN chief
item.description: Ban Ki-moon calls on Vladimir Putin to respect Ukraine’s sovereignty and restore calm in Crimean region and across Europe by pulling armed forces out of the country

item.title: Nepal to force Everest climbers to collect rubbish
item.description: Rules designed to combat menace of pollution and garbage on top of the world say climbers must bring at least eight kilos of garbage, aside from their own

item.title: North Korea launches two short-range missiles
item.description: North Korea fires missiles as warning after US and South Korea begin annual war games

item.title: Obama calls leaders of UK, Poland and Germany on Ukraine
item.description: US President Barack Obama speaks to European allies over Russia’s violation of Ukrainian sovereignty and territorial integrity; says it is a breach of international law and threat to peace and security

item.title: At least 11 killed in attack on Pakistan court
item.description: 11 people including a judge killed in an attack on a Pakistan court; loud explosion heard in central Islamabad followed by bursts of gunfire

item.title: Magnitude 6.7 quake hits off Okinawa, Japan
item.description: 6.7 magnitude earth quake hits Japan; no tsunami expected, say authorities

item.title: Russia risks G8 seat, economic turmoil over Ukraine: US
item.description: US Secretary of State John Kerry has harsh words for Russia, over military stand-off against Ukraine

item.title: NATO chief warns 'Europe's peace at risk' as talks begin
item.description: Anders Fogh Rasmussen says Russia must back down from its strong military stance if Europe is to avoid large-scale armed conflict

item.title: 5 Indians among 11 foreigners killed in blast in Qatar
item.description: Blast also claimed the lives of Pakistani, Nepalese and Egyptian nationals, among others

item.title: Ukraine mobilises for war as Russian forces take control
item.description: Stand-off between Russia and the United States continues to escalate, with Putin claiming constitutional right to invade Ukraine and the latter responding by mobilising its armed forces

item.title: Russia launches media war to win support for Ukraine action
item.description: Following parliament’s approval of military force in Ukraine, state media is now trying to drum up support from Russian voters
